p: Another model, Portal to the Public ( https://popnet.pacificsciencecenter.org/), works to connect local scientists with the public ( 2). Scientists commit to a specified number of professional development training sessions where they learn how to adapt terminology, engage in theater games to increase awareness, receive training in designing informal learning experiences, and practice communicating their expertise. When the training is complete, researchers set up their educational activities or studies within a public space, such as a museum, zoo, or aquarium, and share their learning with guests. There is evidence from both of these models that when museums collaborate with researchers, mutual and independent learning goals can be achieved ( 3).
